taskMan.resource

Class ResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.resource.ResourceManager

  • public class ResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The resource manager is the part in the system that will keep the data about resources, users and reservations. The resource manager is capable of unwrapping resourceViews and linking them with specific resource prototypes or concrete resources. The resource manager will make the reservations and keep them for bookkeeping purposes. The resource manager is also responsible for determining when a task is capable of reserving its resources during planning.
    Author:
    Tim Van Den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceManager

        public ResourceManager()
        Instantiate a new ResourceManager. This manager will have no resources nor reservations. One user will be present in the system, the project manager (admin).

    • Method Detail

      • createResourcePrototype

        public boolean createResourcePrototype(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                       java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalTime> availabilityStart,
                                       java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalTime> availabilityEnd)
        Define a new resource type. This will create a new (empty) resource pool based on the new resource type.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - | the name of the new abstract resource
        availabilityStart - | the optional start time of the availability period
        availabilityEnd - | the optional end time of the availability period
        Returns:
        True when the prototype has been successfully initiated, false otherwise

        private boolean isValidPeriod(java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalTime> start,
                              java.util.Optional<java.time.LocalTime> end)
        Check whether the given availability period start and end times are valid
        Parameters:
        start - | the optional startTime that should be valid
        end - | the optional endTime that should be valid
        Returns:
        True if the given timestamps define a valid availability period

        private boolean addResourceType(ResourcePrototype resProt)
        Create a new resourcePool based on a resource prototype
        Parameters:
        resProt - | The resource prototype for which a resource pool should be defined
        Returns:
        true if the new resource pool was successfully added to the system

        Construct a new concrete resource based on a resource prototype
        Parameters:
        resName - | The name for the new concrete resource
        ptype - | The prototype for which a new resource should be made
        Returns:
        True if and only if the new concrete resource was made and added to its correct pool

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • reserve

        public boolean reserve(java.util.List<ResourceView> resources,
                       Task reservingTask,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                       boolean checkCanReserve)
        Reserve a list of resources from a specific start to a specific end time. A reservation will always be made by a task.
        Parameters:
        resources - | The resources to reserve
        reservingTask - | The task making the reservation
        startTime - | The start time of the reservation
        endTime - | The end time of the reservation
        checkCanReserve - | This parameter will define if the method should check if the resource is actually available to reserve from the given start to end time
        Returns:
        True if the new reservation was made and added to the system

      • pickDevs

        public java.util.List<User> pickDevs(java.util.List<ResourceView> devs,
                                     Task reservingTask,
                                     java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                     java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                                     boolean checkCanReserve)
        A method to find the assigned developers and make a reservation for each one. The reservation(s) will be made by the reserving task from the given start time and the given end time.
        Parameters:
        devs - | The developers to assign
        reservingTask - | The task reserving the developers
        start - | The start time of the new reservations
        end - | The end time of the new reservations
        checkCanReserve - | This parameter will define if the method should check if the resource is actually available to reserve from the given start to end time
        Returns:
        The list of users for whom the reservation was made, null if there was an error

      • canReserve

        private boolean canReserve(ConcreteResource resource,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                           java.util.List<Reservation> alreadyReserved)
        Checks whether the given resource can be reserved from the given start time to the given end time.
        Parameters:
        resource - | The resource to check.
        start - | The start time of the reservation.
        end - | The end time of the reservation.
        alreadyReserved - | A list of new reservations (not yet present in the system) to also take into account
        Returns:
        true if the resource can be reserved in the given time slot, else false.

      • pickUnreservedResource

        private ConcreteResource pickUnreservedResource(ResourcePrototype rp,
                                                java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                                java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                                                java.util.List<Reservation> alreadyReserved,
                                                java.util.List<ConcreteResource> dontReserve)
        Picks the Unreserved Resource instances of a given Resource Prototype for the given time period.
        Parameters:
        rp - The resource prototype.
        start - The start time for the reservation.
        end - The end time for the reservation.
        alreadyReserved - Reservations that were already made
        dontReserve - Concrete resources to ignore
        Returns:
        A list of Unreserved Concrete Resources of the Prototype. If none were found, return null.

      • getPoolOf

        private ResourcePool getPoolOf(ResourcePrototype rp)
        Gets the Resource Pool of a given Prototype.
        Parameters:
        rp - The resource prototype
        Returns:
        If the pool exists, return the pool. Else return null.

      • getResourcePrototypes

        public java.util.List<ResourceView> getResourcePrototypes()
        This method will return a list of all prototypes present in the resource pools in this resource manager.
        Returns:
        an immutable list of resource prototypes. For every resource pool present in the system, one resource prototype will be added to this list

      • getDeveloperList

        public java.util.List<ResourceView> getDeveloperList()
        This method will return an immutable list of every user managed by the resource manager that has the DEVELOPER credential
        Returns:
        a list of the developers in the system

      • getPrototypeOf

        public ResourceView getPrototypeOf(ResourceView view)
        This method will find the prototype corresponding to the given resourceView and return a resourceView of that prototype. If there is no prototype associated with the given resource, this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        view - | The resource to find the prototype of
        Returns:
        a resourceView of the prototype associated with the given resource or null if no corresponding prototype was found

      • getConcreteResourcesForPrototype

        public java.util.List<ResourceView> getConcreteResourcesForPrototype(ResourceView resourcePrototype)
        This method will locate the resource pool responsible for the given prototype and return an immutable list of all its concrete resource instances (wrapped in a resourceView object)
        Parameters:
        resourcePrototype - | The prototype for which the concrete resources are wanted
        Returns:
        an immutable list of resourceView linked with the concrete resources based on the given resource prototype, null if the prototype is not associated with any pool

      • unWrapConcreteResourceView

        private ConcreteResource unWrapConcreteResourceView(ResourceView view)
        Unwrap a resourceView to its concrete resource contents. This method will return null if the resource cannot be found
        Parameters:
        view - | The given concrete resource
        Returns:
        the concrete resource found in the resourceView, null if it cannot be found in the resource manager's resource pools

      • unWrapResourcePrototypeView

        private ResourcePrototype unWrapResourcePrototypeView(ResourceView view)
        Unwrap a resourceView to its resource prototype contents. This method will return null if the resource cannot be found
        Parameters:
        view - | The given resource prototype
        Returns:
        the resource prototype found in the resourceView, null if it cannot be found in the resource manager's resource pools

      • unWrapUserView

        private User unWrapUserView(ResourceView view)
        Unwrap a resourceView to its user contents. This method will return null if the resource cannot be found
        Parameters:
        view - | The given user
        Returns:
        the user found in the resourceView, null if it cannot be found in the resource manager's user list

      • isValidRequiredResources

        public java.util.Map<ResourcePrototype,java.lang.Integer> isValidRequiredResources(java.util.Map<ResourceView,java.lang.Integer> reqRes)
        Check whether or not the given resources and their supplied amount exist in the resource manager's resource pools. Also checks whether the required resources for each prototype are present, and conflicting resources are not. Returns the list of Prototypes if they are valid. Returns NULL if they aren't
        Parameters:
        reqRes - | A map linking resourcePrototypes with a specified amount
        Returns:
        The list of prototype if the resources are valid, else return null.

      • hasActiveReservations

        public boolean hasActiveReservations(Task reservedTask)
        Check whether a task has active reservations for all of its required resources
        Parameters:
        reservedTask - | The task for which the reservations should be checked
        Returns:
        true if every required resource has enough active reservations

      • addRequirementsToResource

        public boolean addRequirementsToResource(java.util.List<ResourceView> reqToAdd,
                                         ResourceView prototype)
        Add resource requirements to a prototype
        Parameters:
        reqToAdd - | The new requirements to add
        prototype - | The prototype that the new requirements should be added to
        Returns:
        True if the new requirements were successfully added to the prototype

      • addConflictsToResource

        public boolean addConflictsToResource(java.util.List<ResourceView> conToAdd,
                                      ResourceView prototype)
        Add resource conflicts to a prototype
        Parameters:
        conToAdd - | The new conflicts to add
        prototype - | The prototype that the new conflicts should be added to
        Returns:
        True if the new conflicts were successfully added to the prototype

      • getPossibleStartingTimes

        public java.util.List<java.time.LocalDateTime> getPossibleStartingTimes(Task task,
                                                                        java.util.List<ResourceView> allResources,
                                                                        java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime,
                                                                        int amount)
        Return a specific amount of possible starting times for a task. A task can be planned to start when enough resources are available for the entire estimated duration of the task.
        Parameters:
        task - | The task wants to be planned
        allResources - | The resources that should be available
        currentTime - | The current time, the method will find timestamps after this time
        amount - | The amount of suggestions that should be calculated
        Returns:
        a list of timestamps when a planning could be made without conflicts

      • releaseResources

        public boolean releaseResources(Task task,
                                java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime)
        Any task can call this method to release all active reservations made by this task.
        Parameters:
        task - | The task which wants to release its resources
        currentTime - | The current time, for bookkeeping purposes, reservations will be kept until this time
        Returns:
        True if the resources were successfully released, False otherwise

      • refreshReservations

        public boolean refreshReservations(Task reservingTask,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime newStartDate,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime newEndDate)

      • getAllReservations

        public java.util.List<Reservation> getAllReservations()
        Return an immutable list of all the reservations present in the resource manager
        Returns:
        all reservations

      • getReservedResourcesForTask

        public java.util.List<Resource> getReservedResourcesForTask(Task task)
        Returns the reserved resources for a given task.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to get the reserved resources for.
        Returns:
        A list of resources reserved by a task
